org.sd.text.segment
Class SegmentSequence

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.text.segment.SegmentSequence

public class SegmentSequence
extends java.lang.Object

Container for an ordered sequence of segments.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Summary
SegmentSequence()
          Construct an empty sequence.

          Find the last segment with the given feature at or after the start segment (where null or the first segment indicates the beginning of the sequence), but before the end segment (where null indicates the end of the sequence).

public SegmentSequence()
Construct an empty sequence.

Method Detail

add

public SegmentSequence add(Segment segment)
Add a segment to the end of this sequence.

add

public Segment add(java.lang.String text)
Add a new (non-delim) segment with the given text.

Note that the segment will have no FeatureBag.

Returns:
the new Segment.

add

public Segment add(java.lang.String text,
                   boolean isDelim)
Add a new segment with the given text.

Note that the segment will have no FeatureBag.

Returns:
the new Segment.

add

public SegmentSequence add(SegmentSequence other)
Add the other sequence to the end of this sequence.

public int size()
Get the size of this sequence.

Get the first segment or null.

public Segment getLastSegment()
Get the last segment or null.

getSegment

public Segment getSegment(int position)
Get the segment at the given position.

getSegmentPosition

public int getSegmentPosition(Segment segment)
Get the position of the segment in this sequence.

getNextSegment

public Segment getNextSegment(Segment segment)
Get the segment that follows the given segment in this sequence.

joinSegmentWithNext

public Segment joinSegmentWithNext(Segment segment)
Join the segment with its following segment, returning the now removed following segment.

getPreviousSegment

public Segment getPreviousSegment(Segment segment)
Get the segment that precedes the given segment in this sequence.

If at the first segment, return null.

If the given segment is null, get the last segment.

getSegments

public java.util.LinkedList<Segment> getSegments()
Get the segments.

setStart

public void setStart(Segment segment)
Set the current segment to be the first segment of the sequence.

Note that if the curSegment is null (at the end of the sequence), the sequence will be cleared!

setLast

public void setLast(Segment segment)
Set the current segment to be the last segment of the sequence.

Note that if the curSegment is null (at the end of the sequence), nothing will happen. If the curSegment is at the beginning of the sequence, it will be the only remaining segment!

setEnd

public void setEnd(Segment segment)
Set the current segment to be the end of the sequence, removing it and all following segments.

Note that if the curSegment is null (at the end of the sequence), nothing will happen. If the curSegment is at the beginning of the sequence, the sequence will be empty!

splitSegment

public SegmentSequence splitSegment(Segment segment,
                                    java.lang.String feature)
Split the segment using its feature function, replacing the segment with the results if non-null.

splitSegment

public SegmentSequence splitSegment(Segment segment,
                                    SplitFunction splitFunction)
Split the segment using the split function, replacing the segment with the results if non-null.

replaceSegment

public void replaceSegment(Segment segment,
                           SegmentSequence sequence)
Replace the segment with the sequence's segments.

injectFeatureBag

public SegmentSequence injectFeatureBag(FeatureBag featureBag)
Inject the feature bag into this sequence's segments.

splitSegment

public void splitSegment(Segment segment,
                         java.lang.String[] text)
Replace the segment with multiple segments (all having the same feature bag, but no set features) an item of text.

                                    java.lang.Boolean value,
                                    Segment startSegment,
                                    Segment endSegment)
Find the first segment with the given feature at or after at the start segment, but before the end segment (where null indicates the end of the sequence).

                                   int startPos,
                                   int endPos)

                                   java.lang.Boolean value,
                                   Segment startSegment,
                                   Segment endSegment)
Find the last segment with the given feature at or after the start segment (where null or the first segment indicates the beginning of the sequence), but before the end segment (where null indicates the end of the sequence).
